00036 // Adopted from http://wordaligned.org/articles/cpp-streambufs
00037 class dbgBuf: public std::streambuf
00038 {
00039         friend class dbgStream;
00040         // True immediately after a new line
00041         bool synched;
00042         // True if the owner dbgStream is writing text and false if the user is
00043         bool ownerAccess;
00044         std::streambuf* baseBuf;
00045         std::list<std::string> funcs;
00046         //std::list<std::string> indents;
00047         
00048         // The number of observed '<' characters that have not yet been balanced out by '>' characters.
00049         //      numOpenAngles = 1 means that we're inside an HTML tag
00050         //      numOpenAngles > 1 implies an error or text inside a comment
00051         int numOpenAngles;
00052         
00053         // The number of divs that have been inserted into the output
00054         std::list<int> parentDivs;
00055 
00056 public:
00057         
00058         virtual ~dbgBuf() {};
00059         // Construct a streambuf which tees output to both input
00060         // streambufs.
00061         dbgBuf();
00062         dbgBuf(std::streambuf* baseBuf);
00063         void init(std::streambuf* baseBuf);
00064         
00065 private:
00066         // This dbgBuf has no buffer. So every character "overflows"
00067         // and can be put directly into the teed buffers.
00068         virtual int overflow(int c);
00069         
00070         // Prints the indent to the stream buffer, returns 0 on success non-0 on failure
00071         //int printIndent();
00072         
00073         // Prints the given string to the stream buffer
00074         int printString(std::string s);
00075         
00076         //virtual int sputc(char c);
00077         
00078         virtual std::streamsize xsputn(const char * s, std::streamsize n);
00079         
00080         // Sync buffer.
00081         virtual int sync();
00082         
00083         // Switch between the owner class and user code writing text
00084 protected:
00085         void userAccessing();
00086         void ownerAccessing();
00087 
00088         // Indicates that the application has entered or exited a function
00089         void enterFunc(std::string funcName/*, std::string indent="    "*/);
00090         void exitFunc(std::string funcName);
00091 };

00093 // Stream that uses dbgBuf
00094 class dbgStream : public std::ostream
00095 {
00096         std::ofstream dbgFile;
00097         dbgBuf buf;
00098         std::vector<std::string> colors;
00099         // The root working directory
00100         std::string workDir;
00101         // The directory where all images will be stored
00102         std::string imgPath;

00104         std::string dbgFileName;
00105         // The total number of images in the output file
00106         int numImages;
00107         
00108         std::ofstream summaryF;
00109         bool initialized;
00110 public:
00111         // Construct an ostream which tees output to the supplied
00112         // ostreams.
00113         dbgStream();

00115         void init(std::string title, std::string dbgFileName, std::string workDir, std::string imgPath);
00116         ~dbgStream();

00118         void printDetailFileTrailer();
00119                 
00120         // Indicates that the application has entered or exited a function
00121         void enterFunc(std::string funcName/*, std::string indent="    "*/);
00122         void exitFunc(std::string funcName);
00123                 
00124         // Adds an image to the output with the given extension and returns the path of this image
00125         // so that the caller can write to it.
00126         std::string addImage(std::string ext=".gif");
00127         
00128         // Given a reference to an object that can be represented as a dot graph, create an image from it and add it to the output.
00129         // Return the path of the image.
00130         std::string addDOT(dottable& obj);
00131         // Given a reference to an object that can be represented as a dot graph, create an image of it and return the string
00132         // that must be added to the output to include this image.
00133         std::string addDOTStr(dottable& obj);
00134         // Given a representation of a graph in dot format, create an image from it and add it to the output.
00135         // Return the path of the image.
00136         std::string addDOT(std::string dot);
00137         // The common work code for all the addDOT methods
00138         void addDOT(std::string imgFName, std::string graphName, std::string dot, std::ostream& ret);
00139 };

00167         // Given a string, returns a version of the string with all the control characters that may appear in the 
00168         // string escaped to that the string can be written out to Dbg::dbg with no formatting issues.
00169         // This function can be called on text that has already been escaped with no harm.
